title: Sources: Cards fining Gannon $100K for RB spat

content: The Ravens traded slumping pass rusher Odafe Oweh and a 2027 seventh-round pick to the Chargers on Tuesday in exchange for safety Alohi Gilman and a fifth-round pick in 2026, the teams announced.

content: The panel‚Äôs work remains less known. Had the committee succeeded in its mission, the history of south India would have been different.

title: BJP has finished Nitish Kumar physically and mentally: Pappu Yadav
content: Rajesh Ranjan alias Pappu Yadav, six-times Bihar MP is currently an Independent MP from Purnea in Seemanchal (border) area. Having a¬†bahubali (strongman) image, he also does lot of charity donating money to the needy people. Though it is an Assembly election in Bihar, he has been in the limelight for many reasons. Recently Mr. Yadav was seen sharing dais with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and was also caught on camera when he was not allowed to share the open vehicle in which Rahul Gandhi and Tejashwi Yadav were moving in Patna. The Hindu caught him at his residence in Patna in which he spoke on several issues including giving advice to Tejashwi Yadav and Chirag Paswan to destroy the arrogance. He also asserted that he does not mind even though he was humiliated. Excerpts.

title: NDA will win Ghatshila by-poll, claims Babulal Marandi
content: The ECI on Monday announced by polls for eight Assembly constituencies across seven States and Union Territories scheduled for November 11, with results to be declared on November 14 including Jharkhand‚Äôs Ghatshila

content: He also claimed whenever he spoke truth about the previous regime in J&K, the L-G administration ‚Äúgoes after relatives‚Äù

title: Patients shifted to old emergency wing after fire in Jaipur hospital
content: Only 22 ICU beds, including six in the emergency ward and 16 in the polytrauma ward, were available for the patients needing critical care after the fire incident

title: Activist seeks AG's nod to initiate contempt proceedings over remarks on CJI Gavai
content: A 71-year-old lawyer attempted to hurl a shoe at CJI Gavai in his courtroom in the Supreme Court on Monday

title: Social media takedown notices should be sent ‚Äúcautiously‚Äù and prudently: IT Secy
content: IT Secretary S. Krishnan said that social media takedowns under Sections 69A and 79(3)(b) of the IT Act, 2000 need to be sent with prudence, and must withstand court scrutiny

title: Rain gauges to be set up in all local bodies in Ernakulam soon
content: The project will be implemented on a pilot basis at Ayyampuzha, Kuttampuzha, Elanji, Njarakkal, Ramamangalam, Malayattoor, Chengamanad, Rayamangalam, and Kallorkkad

title: Maharashtra government announces ‚Çπ31,628 crore relief package for flood-affected farmers
content: Under this, farmers with dry land will receive ‚Çπ18,500 per hectare for crop damage, while those with hangami bagayati (seasonal irrigated land) will get ‚Çπ27,000 per hectare, and those with bagayatu (fully irrigated land) will receive compensation of ‚Çπ32,500 per hectare

title: Bombay HC seeks response from Maharashtra govt over faulty e-rickshaws given to disabled beneficiaries¬†
content: The vehicles were manufactured by a Haryana-based company, resulting in delayed servicing and unavailability of spare parts, the petitioners claimed

title: Watch: Why did a Kerala school mime about Palestine spark controversy?
content: A school arts festival in Kasaragod, Kerala, turned controversial after teachers stopped a mime performance supporting Palestine, saying it was political. The move triggered protests, an inquiry, and public debate on artistic freedom and politics in education.

title: Bombay High Court dismisses Anil Ambani‚Äôs petition against SBI‚Äôs fraud classification of Reliance Communications
content: The bank argued that natural justice requires only an opportunity to make a written representation, which Mr. Ambani was given but failed to utilise.

title: MRO inspects ethanol plant at Arugolanu after farmers flag pollution risks
content: Visit follows Chief Minister‚Äôs Office directive; villagers and HRF activists allege the plant‚Äôs proximity to canal and farms violates zoning norms and endangers irrigation sources

title: Bihar SIR: Supreme Court asks EC to give details of 3.7 lakh excluded voters
content: The Supreme Court questioned an NGO's claims of voter list deletions in Bihar, with the Election Commission stating all parties are satisfied and no appeals were filed. Justices urged the NGO to present affidavits from individuals alleging wrongful removal, highlighting the lack of direct complaints despite a significant number of exclusions.

title: Himachal tragedy: 18 dead as landslide strikes bus in Bilaspur; many missing
content: A devastating landslide in Himachal Pradesh's Bilaspur district crushed a private bus, killing at least 18 passengers and leaving many missing. Local residents bravely initiated rescue efforts before authorities arrived, with four survivors, including three children, pulled from the debris. Heavy rainfall is believed to have triggered the tragic incident.

title: UK PM Keir Starmer lands in Mumbai for two-day India visit
content: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer has arrived in Mumbai for his inaugural visit to India as PM. He is scheduled to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday to discuss strengthening the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, including trade, technology, and climate initiatives.

title: 'We set out to do ...': Rohit's first comment after losing captaincy
content: Rohit Sharma reflected on India's journey from the 2023 ODI World Cup final heartbreak to winning the 2024 T20 World Cup and 2025 Champions Trophy. He credited former coach Rahul Dravid and the team's collective belief for instilling a winning mindset and consistency that led to their ICC title triumphs.

title: Nvidia to keep sponsoring H-1B visas despite Trump‚Äôs fee order
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang assured employees the company will cover the new $100,000 H-1B visa fee, aiming to ease concerns after President Trump's executive order. Huang emphasized immigration's crucial role in US technological leadership, stating the fee could help reshape policy and eliminate illegal immigration.

title: ‚ÄòNot entirely organic‚Äô: Goldman Sachs is not convinced with Nvidia's investment in OpenAI
content: Goldman Sachs warns Nvidia's substantial investments in companies like OpenAI could inflate revenue, labeling it "circular revenue." Analyst James Schneider suggests these deals, including a $100 billion commitment to OpenAI, tie customers to Nvidia's ecosystem but raise concerns about the sustainability of customer spending amid significant funding needs.

title: Exclusive: Dhruv Jurel's rise - Batting temperament of Dravid & safe hands like Saha
content: Dhruv Jurel‚Äôs rise from Agra to the Indian Test team is built on unrelenting work ethic, meticulous training, and remarkable temperament. Mentored by Vikram Rathour and coaches at the Rajasthan Royals' academy, the wicketkeeper-batter has impressed with Saha-like glovework and Dravid-like patience.

title: ‚ÄòHopeful‚Äô: Trump meets family of hostage, slain IDF soldier; vows their return
content: President Trump met with released hostage Edan Alexander and the family of slain IDF member Omer Neutra, reiterating his commitment to securing all hostages' release. This meeting occurred as indirect talks in Egypt, involving US officials like Jared Kushner, progressed positively on a prisoner exchange and ceasefire under Trump's plan to end the Gaza war.

title: Jaipur-Ajmer highway inferno: LPG truck collision triggers massive fire
content: A truck carrying LPG cylinders collided with another vehicle on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway near Dudu, triggering multiple explosions and a major fire. Police and fire brigades responded, halting traffic and commencing rescue operations. The fire has since been brought under control with no reported casualties.

title: ‚ÄòEngineers matter‚Äô: Venture capitalist shares lesson from Musk
content: Marc Andreessen advocates for corporate leaders to emulate Elon Musk's radical leadership, particularly his direct engagement with engineers and bypassing mid-level management. He also highlights Musk's effective use of a personal brand over marketing and his aggressive legal tactics for deterrence. Andreessen believes more leaders possess the necessary engineering grasp for this model.

title: Fit & Ready! Rohit makes first public appearance after losing captaincy
content: Rohit Sharma, recently relieved of ODI captaincy, made a striking public appearance at the CEAT Cricket Rating Awards.  Looking significantly fitter and more determined, the veteran opener conveyed a strong message of readiness for international duty.  He expressed his eagerness for the upcoming ODI series against Australia, highlighting the challenging yet enjoyable nature of playing Down Under.

title: Bihar assembly elections: NDA, INDIA bloc race to complete poll pacts
content: Bihar's INDIA bloc faces seat-sharing hurdles as CPI(ML) rejects RJD's offer of 19 seats, demanding 30. Meanwhile, the NDA is also ironing out details with allies, including Chirag Paswan's LJP (Ram Vilas), ahead of the assembly polls.

title: Cough syrup row: Officials failed to detect toxic production for 14 years
content: The inspection, carried out a day after receiving a letter from MP‚Äôs drug controller, confirmed 364 critical and major violations at every stage ‚Äî right from sourcing raw materials to drug making, testing and packing.

title: Jeff Bezoz's career advice to young people: 'Go work at McDonald‚Äôs'
content: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos advises young aspiring entrepreneurs to gain foundational experience by working at McDonald's. He emphasizes that such roles teach crucial skills like responsibility, discipline, and customer interaction, which are vital for long-term success and often overlooked by Gen Z in their pursuit of rapid startup growth.

title: How much did Jonathan Gannon have to pay after the Cardinals‚Äô sideline incident?
content: Arizona Cardinals head coach Jonathan Gannon has been fined $100,000 for a sideline outburst directed at running back Emari Demercado after a crucial fumble.  Despite the heated exchange, Gannon apologized and confirmed no further team or NFL action. The Cardinals, now on a three-game losing streak, face the Colts next, needing to regroup under Gannon's leadership.

title: Mark Carney praises Donald Trump for India - Pakistan ceasefire
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney lauded US President Donald Trump as transformative. Carney cited economic progress and Nato defense increases. He also suggested Trump eased India-Pakistan tensions. India however rejects this, stating the ceasefire followed direct military talks. The conflict began after a terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir. India launched Operation Sindoor in response.

title: Kim Pegula net worth 2025: How the Buffalo Bills owner built her NFL fortune
content: From an abandoned child in South Korea to a sports mogul, Kim Pegula's journey is remarkable. Alongside her husband Terry, she co-owns a $8 billion empire, including the Buffalo Bills and Sabres. Despite a serious health scare in 2022, Kim remains a powerful force in American sports, embodying resilience and leadership.

title: Steph Curry's wife Ayesha makes huge revelation about marriage
content: Ayesha Curry, wife of NBA star Steph Curry, revealed her personal journey. Initially focused on her career, she shifted her priorities to family after marriage and motherhood. Later, she rediscovered her own goals and built a successful career in culinary arts and business. She also co-runs a foundation with Steph Curry.

title: Lauren Kyle shares heartfelt message after Connor McDavid‚Äôs $25M deal
content: Connor McDavid's wife, Lauren Kyle, celebrated his new contract with the Edmonton Oilers. Her reaction mirrored fan relief and pride. The deal offers the team financial flexibility. Kyle's ventures, including Bar Trove, show her commitment to Edmonton. Their life and legacy are growing in the city, strengthening their bond with the community.

title: IPS officer 'shoots self' at home with gunman's revolver; leaves 9-page note
content: Haryana ADGP Y Puran Kumar, known for flagging irregularities and alleged caste bias within his department, was found dead from a gunshot wound at his Chandigarh residence. He had reportedly left a nine-page "final note" and a will before taking his gunman's service revolver in the soundproofed basement of his brother-in-law's house.

title: Prithvi Shaw vs Musheer Khan: Revealed! Why Shaw grabbed his collar and almost hit him
content: Prithvi Shaw's century for Maharashtra against his former team Mumbai in a Ranji Trophy warm-up match ended in a heated exchange with bowler Musheer Khan. Following a dismissal, alleged sledging led to a confrontation, though Maharashtra's captain downplayed the incident as a practice match occurrence.

title: Ukraine claims capturing Indian national fighting for Russian army - what we know
content: Ukrainian forces have reportedly captured a 22-year-old Indian national fighting for the Russian army. Indian authorities are verifying the reports. The man, identified as Majoti Sahil Mohammed from Gujarat, allegedly joined the Russian military after a drug conviction. He claims he did not want to fight and surrendered. He was reportedly promised freedom and payment but received none.

title: Fat-loss drug Mounjaro now India's No. 2 pharma brand
content: Eli Lilly's weight-loss drug Mounjaro is rapidly climbing the ranks in the Indian pharmaceutical market, nearing GlaxoSmithKline's antibiotic Augmentin in monthly sales. Launched in March, Mounjaro generated Rs 80 crore in September, becoming the second-largest brand. Its high unit value contributes significantly to its impressive revenue despite lower volumes.

title: Maple Leafs star Matthew Knies‚Äô emotional moment about Ella Huber
content: Matthew Knies revealed a personal disappointment during a podcast appearance, as his girlfriend Ella Huber was drafted by the Boston Fleet in the PWHL, just missing a chance to join him in Toronto. Despite this bittersweet moment, Knies remains focused on the Maple Leafs' long-term success, signing a team-friendly deal and prioritizing team goals for the upcoming season.

title: Blunder! Suryavanshi pleads with umpire after shock dismissal ‚Äì watch video
content: India U19 batter Vaibhav Suryavanshi was controversially given out for 20 in the second Youth Test against Australia U19. The 14-year-old prodigy, who previously scored a century, protested the umpire's decision. Earlier, India's bowling attack, led by Henil and Khilan Patel, dismissed Australia for 135, giving India a slight first-innings lead.

title: Cough syrup tragedy: Toll hits 17; doctors say toxic chemical affecting brain
content: Two more children have died from toxic cough syrup Coldrif in Madhya Pradesh, bringing the total to 17 in 43 days. Both victims suffered renal failure and severe brain damage due to diethylene glycol, found at nearly 500% above permissible limits. Officials are conducting a door-to-door survey to retrieve remaining bottles of the banned syrup.

title: Bombay high court: Anil Ambani liable as his company's account tagged fraud
content: Bombay High Court upheld SBI's decision to declare Reliance Communications' loan account as fraud, holding promoters like Anil Ambani liable for company actions. The court dismissed Ambani's challenge, stating promoters in control are automatically subject to penal measures and debarred from raising funds.  Ambani's petition was deemed to have no merit.

title: PM Modi goes past yet another milestone; vows to work harder
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi marked his 25th year in constitutional office, vowing to work harder for a 'Viksit Bharat'. Reflecting on his tenures as Gujarat CM and Prime Minister, he highlighted overcoming challenges and empowering citizens, particularly Nari Shakti, Yuva Shakti, and Annadatas. Modi recalled his mother's advice to always work for the poor and remain incorruptible.

title: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf‚Äôs kids: What Jaden & Jaz are up to in 2025
content: Tennis legends Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf prioritized a normal upbringing for their children, Jaden and Jaz Elle, allowing them to pursue individual passions. Jaden is now building a baseball career, while Jaz Elle enjoys a private life focused on arts and outdoor activities. Their parents offer unwavering support, fostering their dreams without pressure.

title: 'Demonises Muslims': SC to examine if BJP video attracts hate speech FIR
content: The Supreme Court has agreed to examine a plea seeking an FIR against Assam BJP for a video alleging Muslims would take over the state. Petitioners argue the video vilifies Muslims and violates the apex court's order against hate speech. The court issued notice and will hear the case on October 28.

title: Texas 'invades' Illinois: Trump‚Äôs move sparks uproar - is US headed for a new civil war?
content: Texas National Guard troops deployed to Chicago, sparking fears of a new Civil War, with political leaders on both sides accusing each other of inciting conflict. This escalation follows a federal judge's decision to allow the deployment, despite objections from Illinois' Democratic leaders, as President Trump warned of using the Insurrection Act.

title: Shannon Sharpe‚Äôs alleged demand before meeting OnlyFans model sparks buzz
content: NFL legend Shannon Sharpe faced a lawsuit from an OnlyFans model accusing him of sexual assault and threats. Despite strongly denying the allegations, Sharpe reportedly paid the model $20 million. The lawsuit detailed a "rocky consensual relationship" and Sharpe's alleged failure to respect a "no."

title: 'Spoke with my friend': PM Modi calls Putin to wish him on his birthday
content: Prime Minister Modi and President Putin spoke ahead of their annual summit, reaffirming a strong India-Russia strategic partnership. Modi extended birthday wishes to Putin, expressing appreciation for his dedication to bilateral ties. The Russian President is expected in India on December 6 for their 23rd summit, marking his first visit since the Ukraine conflict began.

title: UK: British Sikh group prepares legal action over Islamophobia definition
content: A British Sikh organisation is threatening legal action against the UK government over a potential new definition of Islamophobia. The Network of Sikh Organisations (NSO) argues that any government-backed definition risks discriminating against other faiths and infringing on freedom of speech and religion. The NSO highlights historical and religious practices that could be deemed Islamophobic under existing definitions.

title: Taylor Swift‚Äôs strained bond with Blake Lively shifts after Travis Kelce‚Äôs move
content: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce have maintained distance from Blake Lively following legal drama. Recently, Travis Kelce's podcast rereleased an episode reviewing Blake Lively's movie, 'The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants.' This has sparked fan speculation, especially with Swift's new album release, as neither star has publicly addressed their reported fallout.

title: 5 eye health myths that could be hurting our vision
content: Common eye health myths are debunked, revealing that kajal doesn't protect eyes, glasses don't weaken vision, and eye diseases can affect all ages.  Natural remedies lack scientific backing for vision correction, and cataract surgery is best done when vision is impacted, not when the cataract is 'ripe'.  Prioritize regular check-ups for optimal eye care.

title: Bumper harvest: Auto retails surge 34% in Navratri period on GST cuts
content: Auto retails surged by a record 34% to 11.6 lakh units during the Navratri period, driven by GST cuts and the start of the festive season. Passenger cars and two-wheelers saw significant growth, with dealerships reporting record footfalls and deliveries, setting a promising tone for sustained demand.

title: ‚ÄòReal chance‚Äô: Donald Trump says Gaza peace deal ‚Äòvery close‚Äô; may reshape Middel East
content: US President Donald Trump believes a Gaza peace deal is possible. Indirect talks between Hamas and Israeli representatives are underway in Egypt. US negotiators are actively involved in efforts to broker a ceasefire and resolve the broader conflict. The negotiations focus on hostage release and a potential broader regional peace. The plan includes a ceasefire, Hamas disarmament, and Israeli withdrawal.

title: CeeDee Lamb expected to return in Week 6 or 7 amid latest Cowboys injury updates
content: Dallas Cowboys anticipate the return of star receiver CeeDee Lamb within two weeks following a high-ankle sprain. While Lamb recovers, teammates like George Pickens and Jalen Tolbert have stepped up.  Lamb faced criticism for crucial drops in the season opener against the Eagles, highlighting the team's reliance on his performance.

title: Jammu: Vaishno Devi yatra to resume today after 3-day rain hiccup
content: The pilgrimage to the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Cave Shrine, halted for three days due to heavy rain forecasts, is set to resume on Wednesday. The yatra was previously suspended on August 26 following a landslide that claimed 34 lives, and had resumed on September 17.

title: 44% drop: How number of Indian students going to US has declined
content: Student arrivals from India fell 44 percent, the sharpest fall among all major source countries. Overall international student arrivals to the US dropped 19 percent, indicating that the fall among Indians is far steeper than the global average. The downturn follows a smaller decline last year, showing a continuing trend rather than a one-time disruption.

title: Gabrielle Union recalls emotional toll of surrogacy, says she saw her bump as ‚Äòfailure
content: Gabrielle Union and Dwyane Wade faced significant struggles with infertility and miscarriages before opting for surrogacy. Union candidly shared her feelings of disconnect and perceived failure during the surrogacy process, even with a surrogate of a different ethnicity. Despite these challenges, the couple has built a beautiful life raising their daughter, Kaavia.

title: Gold rush! Despite record prices, central banks add it to forex portfolio
content: Central banks continued gold purchases in August, adding 15 tonnes to reserves despite elevated prices, as they diversify away from US debt. The National Bank of Kazakhstan led buying. Global uncertainties and limited supply support continued demand for gold.

title: NIA files chargesheet against eight more accused in LeT-linked narco-terror case
content: The case is related to smuggling of 500 kg of heroin from Pakistan into Gujarat via a sea route, and its further transportation to Punjab

title: India‚Äôs response to U.S. has been uncompromising: Sanjeev Sanyal
content: Sanjeev Sanyal, member of the Prime Minister‚Äôs Economic Advisory Council, said global powers will not create ‚Äúspace‚Äù for India as it grows in power and influence

title: Mamata meets injured BJP MP Murmu but controversy over the attack rages on
content: Despite the attempt to reach out by the Chief Minister, the BJP leadership said that the not a single person was arrested in connection with the attack on MP.

title: Govt will rebuild all bridges, houses in flood affected north Bengal: CM Mamata Banerjee
content: The West Bengal CM directed community kitchens to remain operational till people return to their houses and assured that once the waters recede, a thorough survey will be conducted to assess the extent of the damage

title: Around 1,500 CRPF troops deployed in Ladakh, says official
content: The official said around 400 paramilitary personnel were sent a month before the September 24 violence and denied allegations that CRPF had fired pellet guns to control the violent protests

title: India edges closer to recognising Taliban as Muttaqi to arrive in Delhi for a five-day visit
content: India, China, Pakistan attend 10-nation Moscow Format talks that inducts Mr. Muttaqi as an ‚Äúofficial‚Äù member for the first time, flies Taliban flag; joint statement indirectly slams U.S. bid to reclaim Bagram Air Base

title: Lok Sabha Speaker has sought urgent report on attack on BJP MP, MLA attack in north Bengal: Rijiju
content: No one can accept people taking the law into their own hands, says the Union Minister, referring to the attack on BJP leaders visiting flood-hit areas in West Bengal

title: Fuel outlets seek supply of non-ethanol blended petrol during monsoon
content: The dealers have been stocking up on pumps, ensuring availability of manpower during wet weather, and clearing canopies of leaves and dust to ensure there is proper rainwater drainage

title: Malappuram elders‚Äô grand tour creates memories, breaks records
content: The mega excursion, organised by Malappuram municipality, claims the title of the largest elderly outing ever undertaken in the world

title: Cough syrup death toll rises to 20 in Madhya Pradesh
content: Five children, who consumed adulterated Coldrif, are under treatment for kidney failure; doctors begin indefinite strike in protest against arrest of paediatrician who prescribed the syrup; they seek action against drug manufacturer and those who approved its use

title: Supreme Court issues notice on plea to remove Assam BJP‚Äôs video ‚Äòvilifying‚Äô Muslims
content: The video post from BJP Assam unit‚Äôs X handle shows Muslims ‚Äòtaking over‚Äô the State in the scenario that BJP is not elected to power in the upcoming Assembly elections

title: AIDSO condemns State govt. decision to extend school holidays for survey
content: ‚ÄòThe step taken is undemocratic and it will become a hurdle in ensuring quality education in government and aided schools‚Äô

title: Cash transfer token gesture, doesn‚Äôt address real issues: CPI(ML)-L leader Dipankar Bhattacharya
content: CPI(ML)-Liberation, a constituent of the grand alliance in Bihar, says the Nitish Kumar government paid no heed to the people‚Äôs voices while acquiring land for a power plant in Pirpainti; the party‚Äôs general secretary Dipankar Bhattacharya says the BJP‚Äôs communal politics is ‚Äúcalculated‚Äù and the saffron party is penetrating Bihar in a ‚Äúdangerous way‚Äù; he says the Opposition needs to organise a better campaign, but time is ‚Äúrunning out‚Äù

title: At least 15 dead as landslip crushes bus in Himachal Pradesh
content: CM Sukhu orders expedited rescue and medical care; PM Modi announces ex-gratia relief; casualties could rise as rescue operations were still under way, officials said

title: Rajya Sabha Chairman C.P. Radhakrishnan meets floor leaders, seeks cooperation
content: Opposition members spoke of the deterioration of relations with Treasury, pressed for more time for the Opposition on the floor of the House¬†

title: ‚ÄòNo State¬†has fully complied with key drug quality norms‚Äô
content: Corrective and Preventive Action (CAPA) guidelines form a critical part of Centre‚Äôs revised pharmaceutical manufacturing regulations

title: An honour to serve, says Modi, marking 24 years in public office
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, who entered the 25th year in public service, said the ‚Äúaccomplishment in a democratic system is a great blessing from the people of India‚Äù

title: Don‚Äôt blame the govt., be the innovation: Krishna Ella tells graduates at UoH convocation
content: India, once admired for its pioneering spirit and ingenuity, has become hesitant to take risks, says Bharat Biotech CMD Krishna Ella while addressing graduates at the University of Hyderabad; urges the youth to revive India‚Äôs legacy of imagination, entrepreneurship and fearless experimentation to reclaim its place as a global innovator

title: CM and ministers weigh pros and cons as the High Court is set to hear case on local body reservations
content: According to sources, the Chief Minister expressed confidence that the High Court would take a positive view of the government‚Äôs decision to provide 42% reservations to BCs in local body elections

title: TTD to conduct ‚ÄòDeepavali Asthanam‚Äô on October 20
content: The customary ritual will be organised between 7 a.m. and 9 a.m. to the deities of Lord Malayappa Swamy and His consorts mounted atop the ‚ÄòSarva Bhoopala vahanam‚Äô at Bangaru Vakili

title: Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy invited for Sri Sathya Sai Baba‚Äôs birth centenary celebrations
content: Managing Trustee of Sri Sathya Sai Central Trust Rathnakar calls on Revanth Reddy and extends him an invitation; the Chief Minister recalls the monumental water projects executed by Sri Sathya Sai Baba in Medak and Mahabubnagar districts

title: Paediatricians unhappy about advisory on cough medications for young children
content: State Health department is in the process of formulating clear-cut guidelines on the management of cough illnesses in children, says Health department

title: Bajra can be sown before Bengal gram in the rabi season, says expert
content: Farmers can expect yields of 15‚Äì20 quintals per acre, translating to a net income of around ‚Çπ25,000 per acre, says ANGRAU Director of Research

title: Uttarakhand Governor gives nod for Minority Education Bill; State to abolish Madrasa Board
content: The decision is a historic step towards making the education system in Uttarakhand equitable and modern, says Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami¬†

title: BJP lays siege to Thrissur Corporation office over neglect of Central projects
content: Party accuses Mayor and Corporation of blocking Suresh Gopi‚Äôs development funds for political reasons

title: Row Over Nurses Throwing Bal Thackeray's Father's Book At Official In Mumbai
content: A row has erupted with a video purportedly showing a group of nurses at a civic hospital hurling books written by Prabodhankar Thackeray and another social reformer at an officer who distributed them as a gift before retiring.

title: "Transformative President": Canadian PM Credits Trump Over India-Pak Peace
content: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney has called Donald Trump a "transformative president" and credited him for bringing "peace" between India and Pakistan.

title: Picnic Turns Tragic As 7 Swept Away At Karnataka Dam, 1 Rescued
content: A holiday outing turned tragic when six people from Karnataka's Tumakuru were swept away in the strong currents downstream from the Markonahalli Dam.

title: In Mega Connectivity Boost, PM to Inaugurate Navi Mumbai Airport Today
content: The state-of-the-art Navi Mumbai International Airport will be opened by Prime Minster Narendra Modi today. The airport is expected to boost trade and tourism for Mumbai, Pune and the Konkan area.

title: Hamas Seeks "Guarantees" From US That Israel "Will End War Once And For All"
content: Hamas's top negotiator Khalil El-Hayya said Tuesday during indirect talks with Israel in Egypt that the group "wants guarantees from (US) President Trump and the sponsor countries that the war will end once and for all".

title: Gold Prices Near Record High Of $4,000 Amid US Government Shutdown
content: Gold hit a record high just below $4,000 an ounce as the US government shutdown, a wobble in technology stocks, and political shake-ups in Japan and France buoyed demand.

title: Blasts On Jaipur-Ajmer Highway As Tanker Hits Truck Carrying LPG Cylinders
content: A truck carrying LPG cylinders caught fire following a collision with another truck on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway on Tuesday night, police said.

title: Staffing Shortages Cause More US Flight Delays Amid Government Shutdown
content: Staffing shortages led to more flight delays at airports across the U.S. on Tuesday as the federal government shutdown stretched into a seventh day.

title: Chinese Hackers Said To Target US Law Firms: Report
content: The Federal Bureau of Investigation's Washington field office is investigating a series of alleged infiltrations of prominent U.S. law firms by Chinese hackers, the New York Times reported on Tuesday, citing two people briefed on the matter.

title: Putin Says Russia Has Captured 5,000 Square Kilometers In Ukraine This Year
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Tuesday that Russian forces had captured almost 5,000 square km (1,930 square miles) of land in Ukraine in 2025 and that Moscow retained complete strategic initiative on the battlefield.

title: Greta Thunberg Alleges Torture By Israel After Gaza Flotilla Arrest
content: Swedish activist Greta Thunberg alleged on Tuesday that she and other detainees of the Gaza flotilla were subjected to torture in the Israeli prison they were held.

title: 5 Detained After Alleged 'Assassination Attempt' On Ecuador President
content: Ecuador's President Daniel Noboa escaped unharmed after his motorcade was targeted by stone-hurling protestors and what one minister described as a volley of gunshots Tuesday.

title: Trump Says "Real Chance" To End Gaza War As Israel Marks Oct 7 Anniversary
content: US President Donald Trump voiced optimism that there was a "real chance" to end the war in Gaza, as Israel remembered victims of the October 7 attacks two years ago on Tuesday.

title: Trump Repeats Joke About Canada As "51st US State" As He Meets PM Carney
content: Donald Trump jested with Canadian PM Mark Carney during a bilateral meeting, joking that Canada could be the "51st US State." Carney laughed along, and Trump said that while the two nations have had their differences, they can work them out.

title: Is Trump Planning Something Big Against Venezuela's Nicolas Maduro?
content: Attorney General Pam Bondi, testifying Tuesday in Congress, refused to confirm whether such a memo does exist.

title: Hamas Demands Release Of Key Palestinian Leaders From Israeli Jail
content: Hamas is demanding the release of high-profile Palestinian inmate Marwan Barghouti from an Israeli jail as part of ongoing negotiations on a hostage-prisoner exchange, Egyptian state-linked media reported Tuesday.

title: Video: Massive Jam On Delhi-Kolkata Highway, Vehicles Stuck For 4 Days
content: It is a very long line. Hundreds of vehicles queuing almost bumper-to-bumper have formed this never-ending, not-so-straight line as they have been stranded on a section of the Delhi-Kolkata highway in Bihar for the last four days.

title: 5 Names Being Talked About The Most As Nobel Peace Prize Date Nears
content: All eyes are on US President Donald Trump as the 2025 Nobel Peace Prize announcement is scheduled for Friday. Trump has long made it clear that he wants the world's most coveted peace honour. But he is not the only prominent name on the list.

title: Delhi To Develop 17 Urban Forests To Boost Green Cover, Combat Air Pollution
content: The Delhi government is set to transform 15 scattered patches of vacant land across the national capital into dense urban forests, called 'Namo Vans,' to enhance the city's green cover and combat air pollution.

title: British Sikh Group Prepares For Judicial Review Of Islamophobia Definition
content: A British Sikh organisation opposed to a proposed definition of Islamophobia that it fears would be discriminatory to other communities and religious faiths is preparing to mount a legal challenge against the government if such a move goes ahead.

title: The unraveling of Barcelona has been weeks in the making
content: defending champions laLiga have lost 4-1 to sevilla at the emirates stadium . the defeat was their worst performance under Hansi Flick, says Craig Burley . he says the defeat would have been different if he hadn't fluffed a penalty .

title: Sorting out the bowl picture after another weekend of surprises
content: two preseason college football playoff contenders lost to opponents who had disappointed . last season's inaugural 12-team CFP, the five highest-ranked conference champions will make the field . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8 .

title: Fantasy Buzz: Hampton headed to IR, Gibson out for the year
content: fantasy football is viewed from a fantasy football perspective . the news cycle will constantly affect player values in fantasy football . our fantasy football Buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around the NFL .

title: WWE Crown Jewel: Key stats and info to know before Saturday's premium live event
content: the premium live event (PLE) will be headlined by a pair of matches for the men's and women's crown jewel championships . undisputed WWE champion Cody Rhodes will challenge world heavyweight champion seth Rollins in one match .

title: Is it better to have an early or late bye week? The answer may surprise you
content: the Packers or the Lions are the team to beat in the NFC North through four weeks of the season . the team was reeling, losers of three straight, and Mike Macdonald scheduled a meeting with all three of his coordinators and assistant head coach Leslie Frazier . source: "you can reset your team [during the bye] if you do it the right way"

title: WWE 'Raw' takeaways: Everyone suddenly wants to be World Heavyweight Champion
content: jey Uso, CM Punk and LA Knight are not-so-patiently waiting for a title shot . the current champion, seth Rollins, is focused on bringing home crown jewel hardware . he has yet to beat cody Rhodes in the world heavyweight championship .

title: The best World Series matchup for every type of fan
content: there are 16 possible World Series matchups we could get later in October . a majority of fans might strongly disagree with including . there's something for everyone, from history to star power to longstanding droughts . here are eight of the most exciting possible matchup scenarios .
